org.spongepowered.api.command.args

Class GenericArguments

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.spongepowered.api.command.args.GenericArguments

  • public final class GenericArguments
extends Object
    Class containing factory methods for common command elements.

      • none

        public static CommandElement none()
        Expects no arguments, returns no values.
        Returns:
        An expectation of no arguments

      • markTrue

        public static CommandElement markTrue(Text key)
        Expects no arguments. Adds 'true' to the context when parsed.

        This will return only one value.

        Parameters:
        key - the key to store 'true' under
        Returns:
        the argument

      • playerOrSource

        public static CommandElement playerOrSource(Text key)
        Expect an argument to represent online players, or if nothing matches and the source is a Player, give the player. If nothing matches and the source is not a player, throw an exception.

        Gives values of type Player.

        This argument accepts the following inputs:

        • A player's name
        • A regex that matches the beginning of one or more player's names
        • A selector

        This may return multiple players. If you must only return one, wrap this element in an onlyOne(CommandElement) call.

        Parameters:
        key - The key to store under
        Returns:
        the argument

      • player

        public static CommandElement player(Text key)
        Expect an argument to represent online players. Returns values of type Player.

        This argument accepts the following inputs:

        • A player's name
        • A regex that matches the beginning of one or more player's names
        • A selector

        This may return multiple players. If you must only return one, wrap this element in an onlyOne(CommandElement) call.

        Parameters:
        key - The key to store under
        Returns:
        the argument

      • user

        public static CommandElement user(Text key)
        Expect an argument to represent players who have been online at some point, as a User.

        This argument accepts the following inputs:

        • A player's name (offline or online)
        • A regex that matches the beginning of one or more player's names
        • A selector

        This may return multiple Users. If you must only return one, wrap this element in an onlyOne(CommandElement) call.

        This may not return the Player object for an online user. If you wish to operate on an associated Player object if the user is online, use User.getPlayer().

        Parameters:
        key - The key to store under
        Returns:
        the argument

      • userOrSource

        public static CommandElement userOrSource(Text key)
        Expect an argument to represent players who have been online at some point, as a User, or if nothing matches and the source is a User, give the user. If nothing matches and the source is not a User, throw an exception.

        This argument accepts the following inputs:

        • A player's name (offline or online)
        • A regex that matches the beginning of one or more player's names
        • A selector

        This may return multiple Users. If you must only return one, wrap this element in an onlyOne(CommandElement) call.

        This may not return the Player object for an online user. If you wish to operate on an associated Player object if the user is online, use User.getPlayer().

        Parameters:
        key - The key to store under
        Returns:
        the argument

      • world

        public static CommandElement world(Text key)
        Expect an argument to represent a world. This returns WorldProperties objects rather than an actual World in order to include unloaded worlds.

        This argument accepts the following inputs:

        • A world's name
        • A regex that matches the beginning of one or more world's names

        This may return multiple WorldPropertiess. If you must only return one, wrap this element in an onlyOne(CommandElement) call.

        Parameters:
        key - The key to store under
        Returns:
        the argument

      • dimension

        public static CommandElement dimension(Text key)
        Expect an argument to represent a dimension. Returns values of type DimensionType.

        This argument accepts the following inputs:

        • A dimension's id
        • A regex that matches the beginning of one or more dimension id

        This may return multiple DimensionTypes. If you must only return one, wrap this element in an onlyOne(CommandElement) call.

        Parameters:
        key - The key to store under
        Returns:
        the argument

      • catalogedElement

        public static <T extends CatalogType> CommandElement catalogedElement(Text key,
                                                                      Class<T> catalogType)
        Expect an argument that is a member of the specified CatalogType T.

        This argument accepts the following inputs:

        • The value's CatalogType.getId()
        • A regex that matches the beginning of one or more ids

        This may return multiple instances of T. If you must only return one, wrap this element in an onlyOne(CommandElement) call.

        Type Parameters:
        T - The type to return
        Parameters:
        key - The key to store the resolved value under
        catalogType - The expected CatalogType
        Returns:
        the argument

      • plugin

        public static CommandElement plugin(Text key)
        Expect an argument to represent a PluginContainer's id.

        This argument accepts the following inputs:

        • The specified PluginContainer's id
        • A regex that matches the beginning of one or more plugin id

        This may return multiple PluginContainers. If you must only return one, wrap this element in an onlyOne(CommandElement) call.

        Parameters:
        key - The key to store under
        Returns:
        the argument

      • flags

        public static CommandFlags.Builder flags()
        Gets a builder to create a command element that parses flags.

        There should only be ONE of these in a command element sequence if you wish to use flags. A CommandFlags.Builder can handle multiple flags that have different behaviors. Using multiple builders in the same sequence may cause unexpected behavior.

        Any command elements that are not associated with flags should be placed into the CommandFlags.Builder.buildWith(CommandElement) parameter, allowing the flags to be used throughout the argument string.

        Returns:
        the newly created builder

      • seq

        public static CommandElement seq(CommandElement... elements)
        Consumes a series of arguments. Usage is the elements concatenated
        Parameters:
        elements - The series of arguments to expect
        Returns:
        the element to match the input

      • choices

        public static CommandElement choices(Text key,
                                     Map<String,?> choices)
        Return an argument that allows selecting from a limited set of values.

        If there are 5 or fewer choices available, the choices will be shown in the command usage. Otherwise, the usage will only display only the key.

        Choices are case sensitive. If you do not require case sensitivity, see choicesInsensitive(Text, Map).

        To override this behavior, see choices(Text, Map, boolean, boolean).

        When parsing, only one choice may be selected, returning its associated value.

        Parameters:
        key - The key to store the resulting value under
        choices - The choices users can choose from
        Returns:
        the element to match the input

      • choicesInsensitive

        public static CommandElement choicesInsensitive(Text key,
                                                Map<String,?> choices)
        Return an argument that allows selecting from a limited set of values.

        If there are 5 or fewer choices available, the choices will be shown in the command usage. Otherwise, the usage will only display only the key.

        Choices are not case sensitive. If you require case sensitivity, see choices(Text, Map)

        To override this behavior, see choices(Text, Map, boolean, boolean).

        When parsing, only one choice may be selected, returning its associated value.

        Parameters:
        key - The key to store the resulting value under
        choices - The choices users can choose from
        Returns:
        the element to match the input

      • choices

        public static CommandElement choices(Text key,
                                     Map<String,?> choices,
                                     boolean choicesInUsage)
        Return an argument that allows selecting from a limited set of values.

        Unless choicesInUsage is true, general command usage will only display the provided key.

        Choices are case sensitive. If you do not require case sensitivity, see choices(Text, Map, boolean, boolean)

        When parsing, only one choice may be selected, returning its associated value.

        Parameters:
        key - The key to store the resulting value under
        choices - The choices users can choose from
        choicesInUsage - Whether to display the available choices, or simply the provided key, as part of usage
        Returns:
        the element to match the input

      • choices

        public static CommandElement choices(Text key,
                                     Map<String,?> choices,
                                     boolean choicesInUsage,
                                     boolean caseSensitive)
        Return an argument that allows selecting from a limited set of values.

        Unless choicesInUsage is true, general command usage will only display the provided key.

        When parsing, only one choice may be selected, returning its associated value.

        Parameters:
        key - The key to store the resulting value under
        choices - The choices users can choose from
        choicesInUsage - Whether to display the available choices, or simply the provided key, as part of usage
        caseSensitive - Whether the matches should be case sensitive
        Returns:
        the element to match the input

      • choices

        public static CommandElement choices(Text key,
                                     Supplier<Collection<String>> keys,
                                     Function<String,?> values)
        Return an argument that allows selecting from a limited set of values.

        If there are 5 or fewer choices available, the choices will be shown in the command usage. Otherwise, the usage will only display only the key.

        To override this behavior, see choices(Text, Map, boolean).

        Only one choice may be selected, returning its associated value.

        Parameters:
        key - The key to store the resulting value under
        keys - The function that will supply available keys
        values - The function that maps an element of key to a value and any other key to null
        Returns:
        the element to match the input

      • choices

        public static CommandElement choices(Text key,
                                     Supplier<Collection<String>> keys,
                                     Function<String,?> values,
                                     boolean choicesInUsage)
        Return an argument that allows selecting from a limited set of values. Unless choicesInUsage is true, general command usage will only display the provided key.

        Only one choice may be selected, returning its associated value.

        Parameters:
        key - The key to store the resulting value under
        keys - The function that will supply available keys
        values - The function that maps an element of key to a value and any other key to null
        choicesInUsage - Whether to display the available choices, or simply the provided key, as part of usage
        Returns:
        the element to match the input

      • firstParsing

        public static CommandElement firstParsing(CommandElement... elements)
        Returns a command element that matches the first of the provided elements that parses tab completion matches from all options.
        Parameters:
        elements - The elements to check against
        Returns:
        The command element matching the first passing of the elements provided

      • optional

        public static CommandElement optional(CommandElement element)
        Make the provided command element optional.

        This means the command element is not required. However, if the element is provided with invalid format and there are no more args specified, any errors will still be passed on.

        Parameters:
        element - The element to optionally require
        Returns:
        the element to match the input

      • optional

        public static CommandElement optional(CommandElement element,
                                      Object value)
        Make the provided command element optional.

        This means the command element is not required. However, if the element is provided with invalid format and there are no more args specified, any errors will still be passed on. If the given element's key and value are not null and this element is not provided the element's key will be set to the given value.

        Parameters:
        element - The element to optionally require
        value - The default value to set
        Returns:
        the element to match the input

      • optionalWeak

        public static CommandElement optionalWeak(CommandElement element)
        Make the provided command element optional This means the command element is not required. If the argument is provided but of invalid format, it will be skipped.
        Parameters:
        element - The element to optionally require
        Returns:
        the element to match the input

      • optionalWeak

        public static CommandElement optionalWeak(CommandElement element,
                                          Object value)

        Make the provided command element optional.

        This means the command element is not required.

        • If the argument is provided but of invalid format, it will be skipped.
        • If the given element's key and value are not null and this element is not provided the element's key will be set to the given value.
        Parameters:
        element - The element to optionally require
        value - The default value to set
        Returns:
        the element to match the input

      • repeated

        public static CommandElement repeated(CommandElement element,
                                      int times)
        Require a given command element to be provided a certain number of times.

        Command values will be stored under their provided keys in the CommandContext.

        Parameters:
        element - The element to repeat
        times - The number of times to repeat the element.
        Returns:
        the element to match the input

      • allOf

        public static CommandElement allOf(CommandElement element)
        Require all remaining args to match as many instances of CommandElement as will fit. Command element values will be stored under their provided keys in the CommandContext.
        Parameters:
        element - The element to repeat
        Returns:
        the element to match the input

        public static CommandElement string(Text key)

        Gives values of type String. This will return only one value.

        Returns:

      • bool

        public static CommandElement bool(Text key)
        Require an argument to be a boolean.

        The recognized true values are:

        • true
        • t
        • yes
        • y
        • verymuchso

        The recognized false values are:

        • false
        • f
        • no
        • n
        • notatall

        Gives values of type Boolean. This will return only one value.

        Parameters:
        key - The key to store the parsed argument under
        Returns:
        the element to match the input

      • enumValue

        public static <T extends Enum<T>> CommandElement enumValue(Text key,
                                                           Class<T> type)
        Require the argument to be a key under the provided enum.

        Gives values of type T. This will return only one value.

        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of enum
        Parameters:
        key - The key to store the matched enum value under
        type - The enum class to get enum constants from
        Returns:
        the element to match the input

        Gives values of type String. This will return only one value.

        Parameters:
        key - The key to store the parsed argument under
        Returns:
        the element to match the input

      • remainingRawJoinedStrings

        public static CommandElement remainingRawJoinedStrings(Text key)
        Require one or more strings, without any processing, which are combined into a single, space-separated string.

        Gives values of type String. This will return only one value.

        Parameters:
        key - The key to store the parsed argument under
        Returns:
        the element to match the input

      • literal

        public static CommandElement literal(Text key,
                                     String... expectedArgs)
        Expect a literal sequence of arguments. This element matches the input against a predefined array of arguments expected to be present, case-insensitively.

        This will return only one value.

        Parameters:
        key - The key to add to the context. Will be set to a value of true if this element matches
        expectedArgs - The sequence of arguments expected
        Returns:
        the appropriate command element

      • literal

        public static CommandElement literal(Text key,
                                     @Nullable
                                     Object putValue,
                                     String... expectedArgs)
        Expect a literal sequence of arguments. This element matches the input against a predefined array of arguments expected to be present, case-insensitively.

        This will return only one value.

        Parameters:
        key - The key to store this argument as
        putValue - The value to put at key if this argument matches. May be null
        expectedArgs - The sequence of arguments expected
        Returns:
        the appropriate command element

      • onlyOne

        public static CommandElement onlyOne(CommandElement element)
        Restricts the given command element to only insert one value into the context at the provided key.

        If more than one value is returned by an element, or the target key already contains a value, this will throw an ArgumentParseException

        Parameters:
        element - The element to restrict
        Returns:
        the restricted element

      • requiringPermission

        public static CommandElement requiringPermission(CommandElement element,
                                                 String permission)
        Checks a permission for a given command argument to be used.

        If the element attempts to parse an argument and the user does not have the permission, an ArgumentParseException will be thrown.

        Parameters:
        element - The element to wrap
        permission - The permission to check
        Returns:
        the element

      • requiringPermissionWeak

        public static CommandElement requiringPermissionWeak(CommandElement element,
                                                     String permission)
        Checks a permission for a given command argument to be used.

        If the element attempts to parse an argument and the user does not have the permission, the element will be skipped over.

        If the invoking CommandSource has permission to use the element, but the wrapped element fails to parse, an exception will be reported in the normal way. If you require this element to be truly optional, wrap this element in either optional(CommandElement) or optionalWeak(CommandElement), as required.

        Parameters:
        element - The element to wrap
        permission - The permission to check
        Returns:
        the element

      • entity

        public static CommandElement entity(Text key)
        Expect an argument to represent an Entity.

        This argument accepts the following inputs:

        • A player's name
        • An entity's UUID
        • A regex that matches the beginning of one or more player's names or entities UUIDs.
        • A selector
        Parameters:
        key - The key to store under
        Returns:
        the argument

        • An entity's UUID
        • A regex that matches the beginning of one or more player's names or entities UUIDs.
        • A selector

      • entityOrTarget

        public static CommandElement entityOrTarget(Text key)
        Expect an argument to represent an Entity, or if the argument is not present and the CommandSource is looking at an entity, return that entity.

        This argument accepts the following inputs:

        • A player's name
        • An entity's UUID
        • A regex that matches the beginning of one or more player's names or entities UUIDs.
        • A selector
        Parameters:
        key - The key to store under
        Returns:
        the argument

      • entityOrTarget

        public static CommandElement entityOrTarget(Text key,
                                            Class<? extends Entity> clazz)
        Expect an argument to represent an Entity of the specified type, or if the argument is not present and the CommandSource is looking at an applicable entity, return that entity.

        This argument accepts the following inputs:

        • A player's name (if appropriate)
        • An entity's UUID
        • A regex that matches the beginning of one or more player's names or entities UUIDs.
        • A selector
        Parameters:
        key - The key to store under
        clazz - The type which the entity must subclass
        Returns:
        the argument

      • entityOrTarget

        public static CommandElement entityOrTarget(Text key,
                                            EntityType type)
        Expect an argument to represent an Entity of the specified EntityType, or if the argument is not present and the CommandSource is looking at an applicable entity, return that entity.

        This argument accepts the following inputs:

        • A player's name (if appropriate)
        • An entity's UUID
        • A regex that matches the beginning of one or more player's names or entities UUIDs.
        • A selector
        Parameters:
        key - The key to store under
        type - The type which the entity must be
        Returns:
        the argument

      • text

        public static CommandElement text(Text key,
                                  TextSerializer serializer,
                                  boolean allRemaining)
        Expect an argument to be valid Text.

        This will return only one value.

        Parameters:
        key - The key to store under
        serializer - The serializer to parse the text with
        allRemaining - If true, consumes all remaining arguments; if false, uses a single argument
        Returns:
        the argument

      • dateTime

        public static CommandElement dateTime(Text key)
        Expect an argument to be a date-time, in the form of a LocalDateTime. If no date is specified, LocalDate.now() is used; if no time is specified, LocalTime.MIDNIGHT is used.

        Date-times are expected in the ISO-8601 format.

        This will return only one value.

        Parameters:
        key - The key to store under
        Returns:
        the argument
        See Also:
        ISO-8601

      • dateTimeOrNow

        public static CommandElement dateTimeOrNow(Text key)
        Expect an argument to be a date-time, in the form of a LocalDateTime. If no date is specified, LocalDate.now() is used; if no time is specified, LocalTime.MIDNIGHT is used.

        If no argument at all is specified, defaults to LocalDateTime.now().

        Date-times are expected in the ISO-8601 format.

        This will return only one value.

        Parameters:
        key - The key to store under
        Returns:
        the argument

      • duration

        public static CommandElement duration(Text key)
        Expect an argument to be a Duration.

        Durations are expected in the following format: #D#H#M#S. This is not case sensitive.

        This will return only one value.

        Parameters:
        key - The key to store under
        Returns:
        the argument

      • withSuggestions

        public static CommandElement withSuggestions(CommandElement argument,
                                             Iterable<String> suggestions)
        Uses a custom set of suggestions for an argument. The provided suggestions will replace the regular ones.
        Parameters:
        argument - The element to replace the suggestions of
        suggestions - The suggestions to use
        Returns:
        the argument

      • withSuggestions

        public static CommandElement withSuggestions(CommandElement argument,
                                             Iterable<String> suggestions,
                                             boolean requireBegin)
        Uses a custom set of suggestions for an argument. The provided suggestions will replace the regular ones.

        If requireBegin is false, then the already typed argument will not be used to filter the provided suggestions.

        Parameters:
        argument - The element to replace the suggestions of
        suggestions - The suggestions to use
        requireBegin - Whether or not to require the current argument to begin provided arguments
        Returns:
        the argument

      • withSuggestions

                                             Function<CommandSource,Iterable<String>> suggestions)
        Uses a custom set of suggestions for an argument. The provided suggestions will replace the regular ones.
        Parameters:

        suggestions - A function to return the suggestions to use
        Returns:

      • withSuggestions

        public static CommandElement withSuggestions(CommandElement argument,
                                             Function<CommandSource,Iterable<String>> suggestions,
                                             boolean requireBegin)
        Uses a custom set of suggestions for an argument. The provided suggestions will replace the regular ones.

        If requireBegin is false, then the already typed argument will not be used to filter the provided suggestions.

        Parameters:

        suggestions - A function to return the suggestions to use
        requireBegin - Whether or not to require the current argument to begin provided arguments
        Returns:
        the argument

      • withConstrainedSuggestions

        public static CommandElement withConstrainedSuggestions(CommandElement argument,
                                                        Predicate<String> predicate)
        Filters an argument's suggestions. A suggestion will only be used if it matches the predicate.
        Parameters:
        argument - The element to filter the suggestions of
        predicate - The predicate to test suggestions against
        Returns:
        the argument
